🧙🏽‍♀️ **Financial Wizardry** 🧙🏽‍♀️

☘️ Module 3 - "DON'T YOU DARE FUCK OFF YET" ☘️

•




🧙🏽‍♀️ **Financial Wizardry** 🧙🏽‍♀️

☘️ Module 4 - "WHO EVEN NEEDS A BREAK" ☘️

•




🧙🏽‍♀️ **Financial Wizardry** 🧙🏽‍♀️

☘️ Module 4 - "KEEP GOING WE ARE FUCKING UNBREAKABLE" ☘️

||**“The harder you work, the luckier you get.”**||
•


                                                                                                                                                                                           

> **Congratulations, you completed** <#1144117302548246609>.
> 
> 
> On to the next channel <#1146110593196097608>.

What is Financial Wizardry about?

A It's like Hogwarts for making money. So you get on a train, spend 6 years studying in university and after that you're an official money wizard.
B How to turn yourself into a moneymaking machine, capable of running any type of business, anywhere, anytime, any place under any circumstances. -
C Arno and Tate take turns talking about random shit.

Does speed matter?

A Speed is the foundation of success in business and life in general -
B Speed is overrated. Because if you do things fast the quality degrades. It's basically impossible to do something really quickly AND do it well.
C "Meh, not really bro. Just chill out. Things happen when they happen you know. Can you pass me the joint?"

What is a business?

A A beautiful logo, carefully crafted website, enough inventory to handle months of demand, a nice office and lots of staff.
B An excellent target for the government to squeeze tax revenue out of
C Money In. -

What is a limiting belief people have about testing business ideas?

A Testing new ideas and businesses is never worth it, best to just stick to what everyone else does.
B Testing new ideas and businesses is expensive. -
C Testing new ideas and businesses is not worth it.

What quality allows you to crush it in any business in any industry?

A Creativity and a willingness to go against conventional wisdom -
B A massive budget and a staff of Harvard trained executives
C Balls and a willingness to keep moving forward

When selling something, what does the prospect have to buy into first?
 
A You -
B Your company
C Your product

What is the easiest way to squeeze more profit out of your business?

A Sell your kidney and other non-vital organs
B Liquidate all assets, go to the casino and place EVERYTHING on number 38. Obviously.
C Sell more to existing customers -

What's the main problem with getting legal before you get money in?

A You're confusing meaningless activity with meaningful progress -
B There's no problem, you have to get legal first. Otherwise the success police will raid your home, kill your dog and take you to jail forever
C They're both important so you should do them both at the same time

How can you get money in without incurring high costs?

A Profit from the skills you already have. Look for low-cost or free options such as the people already in your circle. Convince them to work for you and that you will take care of all the formalities. -
B Approach the hotties at your local club and tell them that you’ll make them millionaires if they let you film them in your basement. It will only cost you a few cans of tuna in the first couple of months.
C You can’t. Every successful business out there starts with a considerable amount of financial, personnel, and resource investment. If you want to make lots of money, you must spend lots of money.

What is the magic rule for staff?

A They should be highly attractive and ambitious. You want them to give you status and make you look smart.
B Staff either save you time or make you money. Otherwise, you don't need them. -
C Don’t allow them access to social media. They’ll have to use Wikipedia instead and finally learn something useful that can improve their lives.

Should you hire a company to do your work?

A Definitely! Companies are cheaper and much more efficient.
B No! They are not really interested in making you rich. A company is primarily interested in making itself rich. Hire a student or a freelancer instead. They are cheaper and eager to work. -
C You should always hire a company that has a large number of seasoned professionals. Also, make sure that they still use PowerPoint for presentations.

How can you manage your reputation?

A If you make a mistake, cover it as skillfully as possible. What the eyes don’t see, the heart doesn’t grieve over.
B In general, if you do more good than bad, you will be OK! -
C Hire the best lawyer and accountant you can. Go to church or the temple every week. And if you really have to, avoid being seen in Amsterdam’s Red Light District.

How can you change the way you think about money?

A Prioritize saving! Make it a priority and try to set aside a portion of your income each month.
B Be realistic about your financial situation and don't compare yourself to others. If needed, consider seeking professional help from a financial advisor or therapist who can provide guidance and support. 
C You must think about money all of the time! Educate yourself about it and always look at the world through a money lens. -

What is one way you can do your job better?

A You should always try to multitask and complete chores as fast as you can to exceed all expectations.
B Use your creativity and make a list of all the things you could do to improve the business. Present it to your boss as a risk-free offer. -
C You should seek feedback and criticism from your co-workers before delivering anything. They have a keen interest in helping you grow and succeed.
